resources.name: Login admin user
resources.description:
### User Authentication
This endpoint allows you to authenticate a user.

**URL:** `POST http://localhost:8000/users`


### Request Body 

- `email` (String): The user's email address.
- `password` (String): The user's password.

### Example Request

```
POST /auth HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8000
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "email": "admin_user@gmail.com",
  "password": "123456789"
}

```

### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 200 OK and include a success message and an authentication token in the response body.

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiaWF0IjoxNTE2MjM5MDIyfQ.SflKxwRJSMeKKF2QT4fwpMeJf36POk6yJV_adQssw5c"
}

```

### Error Responses
401 Unauthorized: If the provided credentials are invalid.

```
HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "error": "Unauthorized",
  "message": "Invalid credentials"
}

```

resources.name: Delete info by id
resources.description:
This endpoint allows you to delete a specific book by its ID.

**URL:** `DELETE http://localhost:8000/books/bookId`


### Replace `bookId` with the actual ID of the book you want to delete.


### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 200 OK and include the book's information that has been deleted.

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "created": "2023-08-10T07:14:05.390Z",
  "updated": "2023-08-10T12:03:30.755Z",
  "title": "Book title 2",
  "description": "Some description 2",
  "publisher": "Some publisher 2"
}

```

### Error Responses
404 Not Found: If the book with the specified ID does not exist.

```
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "error": "Book not found",
  "message": "The book with ID bookId was not found"
}

```

resources.name: Get list
resources.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of all books registered in the database.

**URL:** `GET http://localhost:8000/books`

### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 200 OK and include an array of book objects in the response body.

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

[
  {
    "id": "4d88d7a0-4fb8-41f3-b781-1214f3daea7b",
    "created": "2023-08-09T21:57:11.161Z",
    "updated": "2023-08-09T21:57:11.161Z",
    "title": "Book title",
    "description": "Some description",
    "publisher": "Some publisher"
  },
  {
    "id": "a4131b1d-3dec-4a3b-8b68-a17ea88389dd",
    "created": "2023-08-10T07:00:27.952Z",
    "updated": "2023-08-10T07:00:27.952Z",
    "title": "Book title",
    "description": "Some description",
    "publisher": "Some publisher"
  },
  // ... more book objects
]

```

### Error Responses
500 Internal Server Error: If there is an issue retrieving the book data.

```
HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "error": "Internal Server Error",
  "message": "An error occurred while fetching book data"
}

```

resources.name: Update info
resources.description:
This endpoint allows you to update details for a specific book.

**URL:** `PUT http://localhost:8000/books/{bookId}`

### Replace `userId` with the actual ID of the book you want to update.


### Request body 

- `title` (String): The book's title.
- `description` (String): The book's description.
- `publisher` (String): The book's publisher.


### Example Request

```
PUT /books/023cab0e-e3b7-466a-a3d0-a3257f54de68 HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8000
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "title": "Book title 2",
  "description": "Some description 2",
  "publisher": "Some publisher 2"
}

```

### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 200 OK and include the updated book's information in the response body.

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "id": "023cab0e-e3b7-466a-a3d0-a3257f54de68",
  "created": "2023-08-10T07:14:05.390Z",
  "updated": "2023-08-10T12:03:30.755Z",
  "title": "Book title---",
  "description": "Some description----",
  "publisher": "Some publisher---"
}

```

### Error Responses
404 Not Found: If the book with the specified ID does not exist.


```
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "error": "Book not found",
  "message": "The book with ID userId was not found"
}
```

resources.name: Get details
resources.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve details about a specific book.

**URL:** `GET http://localhost:8000/books`

Replace `023cab0e-e3b7-466a-a3d0-a3257f54de68` with the actual ID of the book you want to retrieve details for.


### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 200 OK and include the book's information in the response body.

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "id": "023cab0e-e3b7-466a-a3d0-a3257f54de68",
  "created": "2023-08-10T07:14:05.390Z",
  "updated": "2023-08-10T07:14:05.390Z",
  "title": "Book title",
  "description": "Some description",
  "publisher": "Some publisher"
}

```

### Error Responses
404 Not Found: If the book with the specified ID does not exist.


```
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "error": "Book not found",
  "message": "The book with ID 023cab0e-e3b7-466a-a3d0-a3257f54de68 was not found"
}

```

resources.name: Create a new book
resources.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new book.

**URL:** `POST http://localhost:8000/books`

### Request Body


- `title` (String): The book's title.
- `description` (String): The book's description.
- `publisher` (String): The book's publisher.


### Example request body 

```
POST /books HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8000
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "title": "Book title",
  "description": "Some description",
  "publisher": "Some publisher"
}
```

### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 201 Created and include the newly created book's information in the response body.

```
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "title": "Book title",
  "description": "Some description",
  "publisher": "Some publisher",
  "id": "e7d6244e-72af-4e19-8701-cecc2e460eab",
  "created": "2023-08-10T08:09:43.898Z",
  "updated": "2023-08-10T08:09:43.898Z"
}

```

### Error Responses
400 Bad Request: If the request data is invalid or missing required fields.

```
HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "error": "Validation failed",
  "message": "Validation error message"
}

```

resources.name: Delete admin info
resources.description:
This endpoint allows you to delete a user by their ID.

**URL:** `DELETE http://localhost:8000/users/{userId}`

### Replace `userId` with the actual ID of the user you want to delete.


### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 200 OK and include the user's information that has been deleted.

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "created": "2023-08-10T13:04:35.700Z",
  "updated": "2023-08-10T13:04:35.700Z",
  "name": "Franjo",
  "lastName": "Gonzalez",
  "email": "example@gmail.com",
  "role": "ADMIN",
  "active": true
}

```

### Error Responses
404 Not Found: If the user with the specified ID does not exist.

```
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "error": "User not found",
  "message": "The user with ID 85bf22d0-668c-46e1-9071-36088e5bee66 was not found"
}

```

resources.name: Update status
resources.description:
This endpoint allows you to update the status of a user.

**URL:** `PUT http://localhost:8000/users/status/{userId}`

### Replace `userId` with the actual ID of the user you want to update.

### Request Body 

- `active` (Boolean): The user's status.

### Example Request

```
PUT /users/status/a307d8fd-5cea-42cb-974a-05708d7db0ab HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8000
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "active": false
}

```

### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 200 OK and include the updated user's information in the response body.

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "id": "a307d8fd-5cea-42cb-974a-05708d7db0ab",
  "created": "2023-08-09T20:28:13.533Z",
  "updated": "2023-08-10T12:56:35.017Z",
  "name": "Franjo",
  "lastName": "Gonzalez",
  "email": "example@gmail.com",
  "role": "ADMIN",
  "active": false
}

```

### Error Responses
404 Not Found: If the user with the specified ID does not exist.

```
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "error": "User not found",
  "message": "The user with ID userId was not found"
}

```

resources.name: List all users
resources.description:
Get All Users
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of all users.

**URL:** `GET http://localhost:3000/users`

### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 200 OK and include an array of user objects in the response body.

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

[
  {
    "name": "Franjo",
    "lastName": "Gonzalez",
    "email": "example@gmail.com",
    "role": "ADMIN"
  },
  {
    "name": "John",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "email": "johndoe@example.com",
    "role": "USER"
  },
  // ... more user objects
]

```

### Error Responses
500 Internal Server Error: If there is an issue retrieving the user data.


```
HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "error": "Internal Server Error",
  "message": "An error occurred while fetching user data"
}

```

resources.name: Get user details by id
resources.description:
Get User Details
This endpoint allows you to retrieve details for a specific user.

**URL:** `GET http://localhost:3000/users/{userId}`

Note: **Replace {userId} with the ID of the user you want to retrieve details for.**

### Example URL 
`http://localhost:3000/users/1`

### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 200 OK and include the user's information in the response body.

```
{
  "name": "Franjo",
  "lastName": "Gonzalez",
  "email": "example@gmail.com",
  "password": "kjabfu<onsfkbksfb",
  "role": "ADMIN"
}

```


### Error Responses
404 Not Found: If the user with the specified ID does not exist.

```
{
  "error": "User not found",
  "message": "The user with ID {userId} was not found"
}

```

resources.name: Create a new user
resources.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new user.

**URL:** `POST http://localhost:3000/users`

### Request Body

- `name` (String): The user's name.
- `lastName` (String): The user's last name.
- `email` (String): The user's email address.
- `password` (String): The user's password.
- `role` (String): The user's privilege

### Role parameter

It can be `ADMIN` or `USER` and it has to be in upper case.

### Example Request

```json
POST /users HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:3000
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "name": "Franjo",
  "lastName": "Gonzalez",
  "email": "example@gmail.com",
  "password": "123456789",
  "role": "ADMIN"
}
```

### Response
A successful response will have a status code of 201 Created and include the created user's information in the response body.

```
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "name": "Franjo",
  "lastName": "Gonzalez",
  "email": "example@gmail.com",
  "password": ",mjnsdbshfds",
  "role": "ADMIN"
}
```

### Error Responses
400 Bad Request: If the request data is invalid or missing required fields.

```
HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "error": "Validation failed",
  "message": "Validation error message here"
}
```

resources.name: Health Check
